alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone; Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Madison, Limestone, southeastern Lauderdale, northeastern Lawrence, Moore and Lincoln Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Pulaski to 6 miles southwest of Rogersville. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Huntsville, Decatur, Madison, Athens, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Hazel Green, Rogersville, Ardmore and Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Alabama.
